e4: Switching to the new policy aligns reported earnings with reality, ensuring ethical transparency and reducing potential legal risks. Although there may be initial misunderstandings, communicating this policy change effectively will enhance trust and credibility with investors. Clear, unbiased reporting also prevents sophisticated investors from exploiting retail investors, promoting fairness.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should ensure transparency, accuracy, and honesty in financial disclosures, free of intentional bias or manipulation. It should consider fair treatment of all investors, preventing information asymmetry and ensuring compliance with regulations. Effective communication about any changes and their rationale is crucial, fostering trust and fairness.
e6: Yes, I would ask management how they plan to communicate the policy change to ensure all investors correctly understand the new reporting approach. Additionally, I would inquire about strategies to mitigate potential short-term market volatility and assess any other risks associated with this transition.
